Help us get the word out!

We are thankful to have the Food Bank of Northern Indiana returning to La Porte High School to distribute food supplies for La Porte families. Supplies will be handed out in the F Street parking lot at LPHS. A truck will be on site, and adults over 18 representing their family can drive up to the truck to collect supplies. Those representing their family should be prepared to tell the volunteers how many people are in the family that they are picking up food for. No other questions asked. All greater LaPorte community members are welcome One representative and one distribution of supplies per family.

The details below are posted on the Food Bank's website:

When: Wednesday, April 29, 2020 – LaPorte County 10 a.m. – Noon
Where: LaPorte High School, 602 “F” Street, LaPorte, IN 46350

We encourage our families who will be picking up student lunches in the front of the high school to drive around the block to the “F” Street parking lot and take advantage of the Food Bank supplies that will be handed out during the same 10:00 a.m.-12 p.m. time frame.

February 27 at 2:38 PM ·

Crichfield had an extra special visitor on Tuesday! Mrs. Messacar from the Soil and Water Conservation District gave a presentation on the different animals in LaPorte and what they do to stay warm in the winter. After going over vocabulary like hibernation, adaptation, and migration, they were able to inspect the pelts of native mammals! Then, they played a game where they had to sort different animals into their survival tactics. Did you know that some amphibians essentially freeze during the winter? Yet, they wake up the next spring completely healthy!🐸🐭🦇🦝

shared_text:
La Porte High School
February 29 at 1:47 PM ·

Leap Day gives us an extra 24 hours, and Mrs. Lebo and a group of art students used it to make a beautiful difference. After a great deal of prep work by Lebo, she and a group of talented Slicer artists spent their Saturday morning at the Adult Probation Department at the La Porte Security Complex. The new offices require probationers to enter through the Courthouse, go through screening, and then walk down a long hallway to get to the offices. The LP County Commissioners approved having LPHS improve “the tunnel” with paintings. Inspirational quotes were chosen to line the walls in hopes to connect with probationers coming into the office.

We are proud of our students and Mrs. Lebo for using their talents for good and hope that these messages spark some hope for those who walk that hall.
